channel.title: Need help on making a spell not work in an area
channel.description: I want to make ice barrage not work when the player is at home because it can attack non attackable npcs (I already made the npcs non attackable but when the player uses a multi spell it hits him anyway).

item.title: Need help on making a spell not work in an area
item.dc:creator: @raped_by_who raped by who
item.description:
@raped_by_who wrote:

would look Something like this

not exactly like that.

You’re expecting to be spoonfed.

item.title: Need help on making a spell not work in an area
item.dc:creator: @steelrends steelrends
item.description:
@steelrends wrote:

ehh doesn’t work… here’s my code. I compiled and put in the boolean and got no errors

[code]
if(magicID == 12891) {// Ice Barrage
setAnimation(1979);
if (playerLevel[playerMagic] >= 94) {
stillgfx(369, EnemyY2, EnemyX2);
stillgfx(368, absY, absX);
hitDiff = 0 + misc.random(30);
attackNPCSWithin(369, 40, 2);
teleportToX = absX;
teleportToY = absY;
addSkillXP((90*hitDiff), playerMagic);
setAnimation(709);

		} else {
			sendMessage("You do not have the right level to cast this spell.");
		
		}
	}[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Need help on making a spell not work in an area

item.title: Need help on making a spell not work in an area
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Use an else statement and a boolean.

if(spellID == 12345 && isInArea()) { sendMessage("Can't use that here."); } else {

You may have to use an else-if depending on your code.

The isInArea boolean would look something like this:

public boolean isInArea() { if ((absX >= #### && absX <= #### && absY >= #### && absY <= ####)) return true; else return false; }

Read full topic
